page.title: 19TRANSPORT - ROADS
page.content: {TRANSPORT {Roads-}In one week in Alne from the 3rd to the 7th of June from 1.15 to 2.15pm using the Easingwold road we found out that there were 270 cars, 48 vans, 48 farming vehicles, 32 bikes, 14 lorries, 8 motorbikes and 8 buses. The bus service is to Easingwold and York, approximately every two hours. There is no bus service on a Sunday. In a five-day survey to look where traffic went to after leaving the village by the cross_roads,I found most traffic took the Boroughbridge road, then the York road and then the Flawith road. The road from York to Boroughbridge crosses the road from Alne to Aldwark. A five-day survey of traffic coming into Alne from the cross-roads, I found more traffic came from Aldwark than Tollerton or Flawith
